alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 30 at 9:33PM CDT until May 31 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL FREMONT...SOUTHEASTERN MILLS...NORTHEASTERN JOHNSON... NORTHWESTERN NEMAHA...EASTERN OTOE AND SOUTHEASTERN CASS COUNTIES... At 932 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles west of Tabor to 3 miles west of Brock, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Nebraska City, Sidney, Tabor, Talmage, Union, Dunbar, Randolph, Brock, Julian, Lorton, Thurman, Camp Catron, Duck Creek Recreation Area and Waubonsie State Park. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for southwestern Iowa...and southeastern Nebraska. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
